ratings.note: Strong crossover credit - one notch below investment grade

overview.business_description: Global leader in metal packaging manufacturing, supplying beverage cans, food cans, and aerosol containers to consumer goods companies worldwide. Major supplier to Coca-Cola, Pepsi, AB InBev, and other beverage/food giants. Operations in Americas, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.
business_positives: LOWEST distress score of 7 - tied for best in portfolio
All bonds trading at or ABOVE PAR (100-105)
Ba1/BB+ rated - one notch from IG
Recent EUR 500m at 3.75% - VERY TIGHT pricing
Blue-chip customer base (Coke, Pepsi, AB InBev)
overview.fatal_flaw: Feb 2026 maturity wall approaching (~$1.5bn Sr Notes + EUR 500m notes). Cyclical aluminum/packaging exposure. Revenue declining for 2 years. Competition from plastic/glass alternatives.
overview.ownership: Public (NYSE: CCK). Top shareholders: Vanguard ($1.1bn), BlackRock ($962m), Fidelity ($598m), State Street ($436m), Norway SWF ($184m).
overview.recent_news: Priced EUR 500m senior unsecured 2031 note at 3.75% (Sep 2025) - very tight IG-adjacent pricing. Notes assigned Ba1/BB+ ratings. Strong deleveraging trajectory.

key_ratios.note: Excellent leverage metrics - 2.5x net and IMPROVING. Strong margin expansion.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: EXCELLENT trajectory - Net leverage down from 3.7x to 2.5x. EBITDA growing. Margins expanding from 13.5% to 17.1%. Approaching investment-grade metrics.

maturity_schedule.note: 2026 maturity wall (~$3.3bn) but strong access demonstrated by recent 3.75% issuance

credit_opinion.summary: Crown Holdings is one of the strongest credits in the XO S44 portfolio with the LOWEST distress score (7). The company has executed an impressive deleveraging from 3.7x to 2.5x net leverage while growing EBITDA and expanding margins to 17.1%. All bonds trading at or above par (100-105). Recent EUR 500m issuance at 3.75% demonstrates IG-adjacent market access. Ba1/BB+ rating is one notch from investment grade. Massive $11.7bn market cap and $1.3bn CFFO provide excellent support. While 2026 maturities are significant (~$3.3bn), the company's demonstrated market access and strong metrics suggest refinancing should be straightforward.

distress_indicators.trading_signals: All bonds at 100-105 (at/above par). Recent 3.75% issuance shows IG-adjacent access. LOWEST distress score. Ba1/BB+ rated. Strong deleveraging. Near investment-grade quality.
